info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 10:58PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Hardin, northeastern Crittenden, north central Caldwell, central McLean, central Hopkins, southern Union and Webster Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1057 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sturgis, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Clay around 1105 PM CDT. Providence and Dixon around 1115 PM CDT. This includes Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 114 and 133. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for southern Illinois...and western and northwestern Kentucky.
